Thus have I heard. Once, the Blessed One was dwelling in the Kalandaka Bamboo Grove near the city of RÄjagá¹›ha.
At that time, a certain god, whose appearance was extremely wonderful, came to visit the Buddha in the middle of the night, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, and then stood to one side.
The god's majestic radiance was extremely brilliant, illuminating the Kalandaka Bamboo Grove all around.
At that time, the god spoke a verse to the Buddha, asking:
What is like a sharp sword?
What is like a bitter poison?
What is like a raging fire?
What is like extreme darkness?
At that time, the World-Honored One also spoke a verse to the god, saying:
Coarse words are like a sharp sword, craving is like a bitter poison,
Anger is like a raging fire, ignorance is like extreme darkness.
The god asked again:
Who is said to gain profit?
Who is called the one who loses profit?ğŸ”½What is the solid armor and helmet?
What is the sharp sword and staff?
The World-Honored One said:
The giver is called the one who gains profit, the receiver is called the one who loses profit, patience is the solid armor and helmet, wisdom is the sharp sword and staff.
The god further requested:
What is the thief?
What is the wealth of the wise?
Who is called the robber in the heavens and worlds?
The World-Honored One said:
Wrong thoughts are the thief, precepts and wisdom are the wealth of the wise, in the heavens and worlds, violating precepts can rob and steal.
The god further requested:
Who is the most at ease?
Who is greatly wealthy and noble?ğŸ”½Who is always dignified?
Who is always ugly?
The World-Honored One said:
Those with few desires are most at ease, the contented are greatly wealthy, the morally disciplined are always dignified, the morally undisciplined are always ugly.
The god further requested:
Who are good relatives?
Who are the hateful enemies?
What is the most severe suffering?
What is the highest bliss?
The World-Honored One said:
Merit is the good relatives, sin is the hateful enemy, hell is the most severe suffering, non-arising is the highest bliss.
The god further requested:ğŸ”½What is loved but not suitable?
What is suitable but not loved?
What is the most severe fever?
Who is the great physician?
The World-Honored One said:
The desires are loved but not suitable, liberation is suitable but not loved, craving is the most severe fever, the Buddha is the great physician.
The god further requested:ğŸ”½Who can cover the world?
By whom is the world enchanted?
Who causes one to abandon friends and relatives?
Who again obstructs rebirth in the heavens?
The World-Honored One said:
Ignorance covers the world, the world is enchanted by delusion, stinginess and greed abandon friends and relatives, attachment and clinging obstruct rebirth in the heavens.
The god again requested:
What is not burned by fire, what is not shattered by wind,
what is not rotted by water, what can float and support the world?
Who can bravely confront a king and a thief,
not being invaded and robbed by humans or non-humans?
The World-Honored One said:
Merit is not burned by fire, it is not shattered by wind,
merit is not rotted by water, it can float and support the world.
Merit can bravely confront a king and a thief,
not being invaded and robbed by humans or non-humans.
The god again requested:
I still have doubts now, I ask the Buddha to eliminate them.
In this world and in the next world, who is the greatest deceiver of themselves?
The World-Honored One said:
If one has many precious possessions, but cannot cultivate merit, in this world and in the next world, they are the greatest deceivers of themselves.

At that time, having heard the World-Honored Buddha speak this sutra, the god was overjoyed, marveled at what had never been before, bowed at the Buddha's feet, and suddenly disappeared before the Buddha.
